completion_promises.criterion_text: Command file follows established pattern (usage, examples, process, output format)
completion_promises.evidence: epic-refine.md includes ## Usage, ## Examples, ## Process, and ## Output Format sections following the same structure as epic-create.md. Tests TestCommandStructure verify all four required sections exist plus correct /epic-refine <epic-id> syntax.

Process section documents three phases: Phase 1 (Current State Display with completeness scoring), Phase 2 (Targeted Questions with categories), Phase 3 (Change Summary and Commit with apply options). Each phase has its own dedicated section with full detail. Tests TestThreePhaseFlow verify all three phases are documented in order.

completion_promises.criterion_text: Questions presented one at a time with skip/done options
completion_promises.evidence: Question UX Design section explicitly states 'One question at a time: Questions are never presented as a list' and 'Skip and Done always available: Every question prompt includes reminder: (Type skip to skip, done to finish)'. Output format examples show single question presentation pattern. Tests TestQuestionPresentation verify one-at-a-time, skip, done, and example answers.

completion_promises.criterion_text: --focus flag restricts questions to a single category
completion_promises.evidence: Dedicated --focus Flag section with table mapping all 7 focus values to categories. Documentation states '--focus flag restricts questions to a single category'. Examples show --focus scope, --focus criteria, --focus risks, --focus dependencies, --focus constraints, --focus organisation. Tests TestFocusFlag and TestFocusFlagCategories verify all focus values.

completion_promises.criterion_text: --quick flag skips prompts and applies AI-suggested improvements
completion_promises.evidence: Dedicated --quick Flag section describes non-interactive mode: analyses current content, identifies gaps, generates AI-suggested improvements, applies automatically. Quick Mode Output section shows example output. Options section documents the flag. Tests TestQuickFlag verify documentation and skip/automatic behavior.

completion_promises.criterion_text: Completeness score calculated before and after refinement
completion_promises.evidence: Phase 1 documents completeness calculation with 9-dimension model table (Business Objective 15%, Scope 15%, Success Criteria 20%, etc.). Phase 3 shows before/after comparison in change summary. Output format examples show 'Before Completeness: 45% → After Completeness: 72%'. Tests TestCompletenessScoring verify score, before/after, 9-dimension model, and visual indicators.

Dedicated Refinement History Schema section with YAML example showing date, changes array, completeness_before, and completeness_after fields. Markdown Update section states 'Append a new entry to refinement_history in frontmatter'. Tests TestRefinementHistory verify all schema fields and YAML structure.

completion_promises.criterion_text: Graphiti push after markdown update (graceful degradation)
completion_promises.evidence: Dedicated Graphiti Push section documenting sync after markdown update with graceful degradation: 'If Graphiti is unavailable or not configured: Log a warning, save the markdown update, and continue. The refinement succeeds regardless of Graphiti status.' Output format shows Graphiti sync status indicators. Tests TestGraphitiPush verify both push documentation and graceful degradation.

completion_promises.criterion_text: [REFINE] prefix and visual separators for mode clarity
completion_promises.evidence: Question UX Design section documents '[REFINE] prefix: Every question prompt is prefixed with [REFINE] for clear mode indication' and 'Visual separators: Horizontal rules separate each question/answer cycle'. Output format examples show [REFINE] prefix on all prompts and separator lines. Tests TestModeClarity verify both prefix and separator documentation.

completion_promises.criterion_text: Works in both Claude Code and Claude Desktop
completion_promises.evidence: Dedicated Platform Compatibility section documenting both environments: 'Claude Code: Full interactive experience with terminal prompts' and 'Claude Desktop: Conversational interaction — questions presented as chat messages'. Tests TestPlatformCompatibility verify both platforms mentioned.

completion_promises.criterion_text: Organisation pattern assessment included in question categories
completion_promises.evidence: Organisation is category 7 in the question categories with dedicated question template. Organisation Awareness section documents structural pattern detection: large direct-pattern (8+ tasks) suggests adding features, single-feature epics suggest flattening, mixed pattern suggests consolidation. Tests TestOrganisationAssessment verify all three detection patterns.

test_output_summary: 49 tests passed, 0 failed. 99% coverage on test file. Full test suite: 299 passed with no regressions.
implementation_notes: Created the /epic-refine command definition file following the established pattern from epic-create.md. Implements a three-phase refinement flow (current state display with 9-dimension completeness scoring, targeted questions organised by 7 categories with one-at-a-time UX, and change summary with before/after scoring). Includes --focus flag for single-category restriction, --quick flag for non-interactive AI-suggested improvements, [REFINE] prefix and visual separators for mode clarity, refinement_history YAML schema, Graphiti push with graceful degradation, organisation pattern awareness (large direct detection, single-feature detection, mixed consolidation), and Claude Code + Claude Desktop platform compatibility. TDD approach: wrote 49 failing tests first (RED), then implemented the command file to pass all tests (GREEN).
